result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rick L. Caldwell

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.

9:30 AM Cases called: 22CF725 & 22CM630. Defendant Rick L. Caldwell appeared by video, in custody from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler in court for Rick L. Caldwell.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties are close to an agreement. 

Plea Hearing: 12/21/22 at 10:45am
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Cases 22CF725, 22CM630 are called at 11:58 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Rick L. Caldwell appeared by video, in custody from Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler in court for Rick L. Caldwell.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court advises the Defendant of charges and potential penalties in 22CF725. Defendant enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts in 22CF725. Court receives Not Guilty pleas in 22CF725. 
Status Conference in both cases: 10/25/2022 at 9:30 AM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

**DEF REFUSED TO SIGN **
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Cases called at 9:47 AM: 22CF725, 22CM630.
Defendant Rick L. Caldwell in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman not in court.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant indicates he has not spoken to Ms. Erdman after several phone calls to her. Court orders Attorney Erdman withdrawn. Defendant to contact Public Defender's Office for new representation.
Defendant previously filed Motion to Amend Bond his $750 Cash Bond and it was denied. State objects due to the Defendants history of failing to appear.
Court converts the bond to a $750 Signature Bond with the same conditions.
ARGN: 10/19/22 at 11:45 AM.

Order Denying Defendant's Request for Release Modification or Change in Sentence.
It is ordered that the above request is: Denied.
Dated 08/18/2022, Letter from Court to defendant regarding Motion to Reduce Bond.

Defense's Motion to Reduce Bond
Filed by defendant, received via USPS Mail.

(4:13 PM cases 22CM630, 22CF725 called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rick L. Caldwell appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Rick L. Caldwell.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in case 22CF725 and Court accepts waiver.
Attorney Erdman to schedule an Arraignment in case 22CF725 with Branch 4 Judicial Assistant and case 22CM630 scheduled for a Hearing as case is riding along.

11:26 AM cases 22CF725, 22CM630 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rick L. Caldwell appeared by video, in custody with SPD Intern Clayton Cavanaugh under the supervision of Sonia Anderson. Warrant in 22CF725 is quashed. Defense waives reading of the complaints. Defense State requests a cash bond to cover both files. Court orders $750 cash bond to cover both files.
Hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
